expertSystem.title: Clinical evaluation of a patient with chest pain.

question.content: Medium or high probability of coronary disease based on history?
Intermediate or high risk of unstable angina (rest pain lasting > 20min age > 65 years changes in ST-T pulmonary edema)?
History and diagnostics indicate on-cardiac cause of chest pain?
Recently past heart attack, PCI or CABG?
Assess again probability of coronary disease. Implement primary prevention.
Angina persists after treatment of the causing disease?
Data from the interview and/or examination indicate valve defect, pericardium disease or left ventricle dysfunction.
Indication of risk and prognosis assessment?
See guidelines on stress tests and coronary catheterization.
Does echocardiogram show an advanced primary valve defect?
High probability of coronary disease based on data from history, examination, and ECG?

Empirical treatment.
See guidelines on treatment.

source.linkDescription: Gajewski P., dr med., Goncerz G., Postępowanie w przewlekłej stabilnej dławicy piersiowej. Aktualne (2002) stanowisko American College of Cardiology i American Heart Association.
